data.app_name: Off The Chains Disc Golf Demo
data.description:
This Demo includes the first two (of eight) courses.

Off The Chains Disc Golf is a lighthearted disc golf simulation. Start your disc golfing adventure learning how to play with the friendly AI-controlled DiscBot!

The best part of disc golf? Playing with your friends of course. Enjoy all playable courses with lobby-based private and public matchmaking (yes, even this demo is multiplayer!).

Both experienced disc golfers and newcomers alike will appreciate our realistic disc physics. Each disc has its own rating using a 4-number rating system that will be familiar to disc golf enthusiasts, but easy for newcomers to learn.

Throughout the course of the game you will earn Chain Link points to unlock new discs. Customize the collection that you want to take with you on your next round.

With multiple beautiful courses with varying biomes you may find yourself stopping to just enjoy the scenery. This simulation is designed to be relaxing and enjoyable, yet competitive!

changelog.change_log:
Release notes v1.07 (bug fix update)

- Fixed a bug that caused some players not to be able to unlock the latest map (#8 Bogey Peaks, paid version only)
- Other minor bug fixes and improvements

Release notes v1.06 (bug fix update)

- Fixed a bug that was introduced in the last update and was causing the tutorial to not be marked as completed.
- Fixed a bug that caused you to not be able to start another multiplayer game if you had specifically used the quit menu on the watch

Release notes v1.05

- Added the 8th new map, the biggest course yet called “Bogey Peaks” (paid version only)
- All basket and chain impact sounds have been updated again to be more realistic and reactive to scenarios
- Added a variety of new hats for avatars including the “Red and the Revelers” hat (from the band who performed the music used in our trailer, thanks!)
- Added a variety of new head shapes for avatars
- Fixed terrain clipping issue in the home house
- Added a title to Previous Shot Details in the watch’s scorecard.

Release notes v1.06 (bug fix update)

- Fixed a bug that was introduced in the last update and was causing the tutorial to not be marked as completed.
- Fixed a bug that caused you to not be able to start another multiplayer game if you had specifically used the quit menu on the watch

Release notes v1.05

- Added the 8th new map, the biggest course yet called “Bogey Peaks” (paid version only)
- All basket and chain impact sounds have been updated again to be more realistic and reactive to scenarios
- Added a variety of new hats for avatars including the “Red and the Revelers” hat (from the band who performed the music used in our trailer, thanks!)
- Added a variety of new head shapes for avatars
- Fixed terrain clipping issue in the home house
- Added a title to Previous Shot Details in the watch’s scorecard.

Release notes v1.05

- Added the 8th new map, the biggest course yet called “Bogey Peaks” (paid version only, not in demo version)
- All basket and chain impact sounds have been updated again to be more realistic and reactive to scenarios
- Added a variety of new hats for avatars including the “Red and the Revelers” hat (from the band who performed the music used in our trailer, thanks!)
- Added a variety of new head shapes for avatars
- Fixed terrain clipping issue in the home house
- Added a title to Previous Shot Details in the watch’s scorecard.

Full patch notes for update v1.04:

- Out Of Bounds markers are placed differently to be more forgiving and visually accurate. Some boundaries have been slightly changed and there are more flags to define the boundaries
- Bug fix: chain link points are no longer deducted for hitting trees while playing the tutorial (prevents - issue where you couldn’t progress in the tutorial without 500 chainlinks if you had hit a tree)
- Added release date to demo menu
- Added message to the map selection menu about maps 3-7 not being available to unlock in the demo
- Made FollowCam on by default on Quest 1 (was already the default for Quest 2)
- Added link in demo to "Purchase Full Game"

Patch notes v1.04:

- Out Of Bounds markers are placed differently to be more forgiving and visually accurate. Some boundaries have been slightly changed and there are more flags to define the boundaries
- Bug fix: chain link points are no longer deducted for hitting trees while playing the tutorial (prevents - issue where you couldn’t progress in the tutorial without 500 chainlinks if you had hit a tree)
- Added release date to demo menu
- Added message to the map selection menu about maps 3-7 not being available to unlock in the demo
- Made FollowCam on by default on Quest 1 (was already the default for Quest 2)

Patch notes v1.03:

- Santa Hat added as a wearable item for your avatar!
- DiscBot will now wear a Santa Hat every year during the holiday season!
- Fixed font size for the Quick UI to properly fit “Next Player’s Turn” (and added the missing apostrophe to the font)
- Solved bug that could be exploited to get unlimited birdies if you knew how
- Fix for issues with multiplayer turn order when 3 or more players are on the card
- Occasionally you would not teleport to where your disc landed upon using “go to shot”. Teleport is now more resilient to failure to further prevent this from happening.
- Fixed the “mulligan bug” where you could move out of and back into your shot area while the disc was in flight to be able to re-open your bag and take a shot from the same place you just took a shot from
- Fixed some cases where your shot area could visually appear in a tree when moving around the course manually
- Fixed bug where sometimes the “Go To Shot” button would not appear (particularly if you were moving around outside your shot area while your shot was happening)
- Fixed bug where sometimes the throw power difficulty you picked in settings was not “sticking” before entering a match
- Since the previous update there are now some Par 5 holes in the game - because of this, we added the ability to get an Albatross (3 under Par). This is also now tracked on the stats page in the menus
- Removed Random Objects (say goodbye to the great red arrow)
- Fixed typo for multiplayer map names
- Hilly Forest is now displayed as an “easy” course
- Updated sun tint on brisky and hilly forest.
- Fixed UV and scaling issues with tee pads
- Updated map 5 signpost images on a few incorrectly displayed boundary lines.
- Removed ‘labels’ from the power meter that is displayed while the disc is flying. Minor UI adjustments to the ‘perfect zone’
- Fixed tree collider issues that could have caused players to spawn inside trees
- Performance fix on Hilly Forest map

Patch notes v1.01:

- Graphics improvements: Better lighting and more defined shadows throughout the whole game. Some updates were made to shaders for better quality and colors on foliage. Terrain textures are more blended and natural for a more realistic look. Some terrain textures have been updated and changed. Grass and flowers have been added in spots on some maps. Some textures on objects such as the gazebos have been updated to be higher quality.
- Added running tally’s against par (-/+) to the in-game score card
- Updated appearance of multiplayer winners on the in-game score card
- Added a close button to the in-game settings menu (you can still open/close it with the left menu button though)
- Fixed some lighting issues on Inway Trees Park - especially in bridge area
- Fixed bug in which the game may think that you’re still playing the tutorial after quitting to the main menu during the in-game tutorial section on Mount Pond.
- The screenshots in the in-game tutorial section on Mount Pond have been updated to show the new UI. The disc stability chart has been replaced with a basic description of the 4 number rating system on discs.
- Par numbers on Sans Trap have been updated to have fewer Par 3’s and more Par 4’s due to distance

Patch notes v1.02:
- Fixed bug with multiplayer running par tally being incorrect in some circumstances

Patch notes v1.01:

- Graphics improvements: Better lighting and more defined shadows throughout the whole game. Some updates were made to shaders for better quality and colors on foliage. Terrain textures are more blended and natural for a more realistic look. Some terrain textures have been updated and changed. Grass and flowers have been added in spots on some maps. Some textures on objects such as the gazebos have been updated to be higher quality.
- Added running tally’s against par (-/+) to the in-game score card
- Updated appearance of multiplayer winners on the in-game score card
- Added a close button to the in-game settings menu (you can still open/close it with the left menu button though)
- The 7th and final map was added for Quest private beta (round 2) players
- Fixed some lighting issues on Inway Trees Park - especially in bridge area
- Fixed bug in which the game may think that you’re still playing the tutorial after quitting to the main menu during the in-game tutorial section on Mount Pond.
- The screenshots in the in-game tutorial section on Mount Pond have been updated to show the new UI. The disc stability chart has been replaced with a basic description of the 4 number rating system on discs.
- Par numbers on Sans Trap have been updated to have fewer Par 3’s and more Par 4’s due to distance

v0.47 Patch Notes:

- An interactive tutorial was added with a brand new in-game AI character that can throw discs (among other things). The usage of AI characters will be expanded upon in future game content and this is our first example of that. The tutorial is required to play through once and will automatically start when you load the game. It’s 5-10 minutes long. If you want, you can skip playing the game on mount pound at the end of the tutorial, it will still count as completed once you have loaded the map once (but you will of course miss the pointers that pop up at each hole).
- Some minor graphical improvements: some shading on the hands, reflectivity on metal objects like the baskets, trash cans, etc
- Basket chain racks have been updated to be a brighter more attractive yellow
- UI update: we have changed our UI’s overall “branding”. All styling was updated for the menus both in-game and on the main menu. This is still a work in progress and we’re happy to receive feedback on this.
- If you aren’t looking at your watch for a couple seconds it will now automatically close
- You can now see the reverse side of water if you’re underneath it on Quest.
- On PC, we’ve switched to the same water shader that we’re using on Quest for a big performance boost and to unify the look of different versions of the game. We have on the list to do some additional water updates in the future that both PC and Quest will receive.
- “Next Tee” signs have been added to all of the maps so it’s easy to tell what direction the next hole is if you’re walking manually.

v0.46 Patch Notes:

- Physics overhaul 4 is our new physics system designed from the ground up. This new system is much more dynamic and realistic than any previous physics iteration for the game.
- There is a new option in the settings menu to pick your “throw power difficulty”. It is suggested to test out these settings before starting a game. 
- New power meter attached to the FollowCam will show you the expected power range for each disc and where you fell within that range for each shot.
- New home menu map that better fits the theme of the game. This will eventually also be used as the home for some new mini games, the interactive tutorial, and multiplayer lobby.
- Replaced menu hover over sound with haptic feedback (vibration) instead
- Feature removal: you can no longer see discs behind terrain. Some assumed this was a bug rather than a feature - in either case, it is removed.
- Old video tutorials have been removed - these were heavily outdated and will be replaced by an upcoming interactive tutorial.
- When in free mode the FollowCam will disappear promptly any time that you open your bag to take another shot
- Fixed alignment of loading screen for main menu screen
- For the Quest private beta we have added the 6th course for internal testing, Inway Hills Park

v0.45 patch notes:

- For out of bounds shots you will now be moved to the closest out of bounds flag from where your disc flew over the out of bounds line. For multiplayer your “teleport to current player” location will be at this adjusted spot as well.
- For out of bounds shots the distance to basket reported in the UI will now reflect the location where you will be taking your next shot rather than where your disc landed out of bounds. For multiplayer, this correctly adjusted location will be used in the calculation for “who goes next” (should solve inconsistencies in turn order for multiplayer with OOB shots).
- Disabled disc auto grab while the menu is open (so that you don’t accidentally grab and drop a disc when using the laser pointer to interact with the menu).
- Fixed bug where the disc info UI and auto-grab function would stop working during gameplay (often would happen when doing a fast-teleport while your bag is already open in front of you)
- Fixed bug that only happened on certain courses in which if you had both highlighted the go to shot button with the laser while also using the fast go to shot controller button it would teleport you twice (once half way through the spinner, and another when the spinner had completed)

v0.44 hotfix:

- Revert previous disc physics changes

v0.43 hotfix:

- Fixed bug that would allow you to recall your disc while in the air with the distance grab on the opposite controller

v0.42 Release Notes:

- Solved a bug introduced with the intuitive bag changes that could potentially break game flow (symptom would usually be that discs would not highlight, hand animations would cease, and then the game could not proceed)
- Your disc bag can no longer spawn inside a tree if your disc lands right next to one. You will instead take your next shot from right in front of the tree in the direction of the basket.
- Fixed bug that could cause highlight to happen after picking up a disc if you grab it super fast before your disc bag is open
- Physics tweaks: putters have further been adjusted, drivers distance capability further corrected. Improved s-curve and hyzer flip shot types.
- Fixed bug that would allow you to grab your opponents discs in multiplayer
- In multiplayer when a player shoots out of bounds, your “teleport behind the next player” point is now moved to where they will actually be for their next shot rather than where their disc had landed
- Disabled laser pointer for the watch - these are physical buttons to press so no laser pointer is necessary. Disabled distance grab for auto-highlighted disc when the watch is open (so that you can point at watch buttons without accidentally grabbing a disc).

v0.43 hotfix:

- Fixed bug that would allow you to recall your disc while in the air with the distance grab on the opposite controller

v0.42 Release Notes:

- Solved a bug introduced with the intuitive bag changes that could potentially break game flow (symptom would usually be that discs would not highlight, hand animations would cease, and then the game could not proceed)
- Your disc bag can no longer spawn inside a tree if your disc lands right next to one. You will instead take your next shot from right in front of the tree in the direction of the basket.
- Fixed bug that could cause highlight to happen after picking up a disc if you grab it super fast before your disc bag is open
- Physics tweaks: putters have further been adjusted, drivers distance capability further corrected. Improved s-curve and hyzer flip shot types.
- Fixed bug that would allow you to grab your opponents discs in multiplayer
- In multiplayer when a player shoots out of bounds, your “teleport behind the next player” point is now moved to where they will actually be for their next shot rather than where their disc had landed
- Re-enabled updating save file after each hole for Quest
- Disabled laser pointer for the watch - these are physical buttons to press so no laser pointer is necessary. Disabled distance grab for auto-highlighted disc when the watch is open (so that you can point at watch buttons without accidentally grabbing a disc).

Release notes v0.42

- Solved a bug introduced with the intuitive bag changes that could potentially break game flow (symptom would usually be that discs would not highlight, hand animations would cease, and then the game could not proceed)
- Your disc bag can no longer spawn inside a tree if your disc lands right next to one. You will instead take your next shot from right in front of the tree in the direction of the basket.
- Fixed bug that could cause highlight to happen after picking up a disc if you grab it super fast before your disc bag is open
- Physics tweaks: putters have further been adjusted, drivers distance capability further corrected. Improved s-curve and hyzer flip shot types.
- Fixed bug that would allow you to grab your opponents discs in multiplayer
- In multiplayer when a player shoots out of bounds, your “teleport behind the next player” point is now moved to where they will actually be for their next shot rather than where their disc had landed
- Re-enabled updating save file after each hole for Quest
- Disabled laser pointer for the watch - these are physical buttons to press so no laser pointer is necessary. Disabled distance grab for auto-highlighted disc when the watch is open (so that you can point at watch buttons without accidentally grabbing a disc).

Beta v0.41

- Disc physics changes: Increased Mid-Range and Driver distances. Slight increase to fade for longer thrown discs. Putters anhyzer is smoothed out with slight increase in putter distances. Discs thrown upwards now have a smoother transition with gravity application.
- Bug fix for some cases where “disappearing/stuck discs” were possible in multiplayer. If you still encounter any multiplayer issues, please let us know in our discord how to reproduce it and we’ll be happy to get it fixed!
- Disc bag functionality changes: We’ve smoothed out the disc selection process so it doesn’t feel so “touchy”. When selecting discs, they will stay highlighted. It will not re-select discs that are already selected. If a disc is highlighted, you don’t need to be near it to grab it - simply pressing the trigger/grab button will bring it to your hand. The game will try to pick the appropriate disc for the shot and it will automatically be highlighted the next time your bag opens (so selecting a disc is often unnecessary, you can just press trigger and keep playing!). - - In addition, you can now only grab the bag from the sides, not the front or the back (so this doesn’t interfere with disc selection).
- Fixed a bug with using your off hand to highlight/move discs in your opposite hand
- Fixed bug that could allow you to teleport to your next shot early as soon as your disc lands (could have potentially affected game flow in multiplayer)

v0.40 Patch Notes

- Further performance improvements
- Increased texture resolution for the most commonly used UI elements
- Renamed “teleport to next shot” to simply be “Go To Shot”
- Added the name of the shot to the FollowCam (ex. “Hyzer Flip”, “Long Straight” etc)
- Adjusted and removed some repetitive sounds (more sound work to come in the future)
- Multiplayer game flow bug fixes (there always could be more, please let us know in our discord if you find any and we’ll be happy to solve them!)
- Fixed bug that could cause you to be able to open your bag and re-shoot from your previous shot location
- Fixed bug that could cause a player to open their bag and take a shot out of turn in multiplayer (which in turn could break multiplayer game flow)
- Fixed bug with the shot area circle that could break multiplayer gameflow in some cases
- In multiplayer, if you've already moved to your next shot area before it's your turn, your turn will automatically start when it's time
- Replaced checkboxes and checkmarks in settings menu to be higher quality and uniform with the games branding
- Fixed issue where multiplayer scorecard would overlap with your last shot details menu
- Eliminated the seam in the galactic skybox on the main menu scene
